channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Former Tesla board member says he wouldn’t vote for Musk’s $56 billion pay package
item.description: This is “hubris,” said the former audit chairman and VC.

item.title: China's exports grow more than expected in May, up by 7.6%
item.description: China's exports in May grew faster than expected, while imports missed forecasts, customs data showed Friday.

item.title: Charles Barkley says the best money advice he got was from this NBA star’s mom
Tesla board chair says not paying Elon Musk is unfair—‘Put yourself in his shoes’
item.description: Investors will vote on the Tesla CEO’s $56 billion stock option package next week.

item.title: China's Alibaba is courting European and U.S. small businesses as it goes global
item.description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba is ramping up its global expansion with new services aimed at attracting small businesses in the U.S. and Europe.

item.title: 'On Watch' podcast: A new era for crypto is approaching
Tokyo’s government plays matchmaker with new dating app to reverse its plunging birth rate
item.description: The app will have strict prerequisites to help fight scams and misrepresentation.

item.title: Trump heads to tech fundraiser in San Francisco, with some guests paying $300,000
item.description: David Sacks and Chamath Palihapitiya are hosting a fundraiser for Donald Trump at a San Francisco mansion.

item.title: How a ‘Reverend CEO’ allegedly stole $1 billion in a crypto scam
Teacher absences are worse now than during the pandemic. It’s costing schools $4 billion a year and some students ‘will never get back on track’
item.description: Teachers say absences are a symptom of more student behavioral issues, fewer resources, and low salaries eaten away by inflation.

item.title: Jim Cramer explains what's at stake for consumers in the May jobs report
item.description: "Wall Street may be rooting for a weaker job market so that the Fed can start cutting rates, but keep in mind what you're betting against," Cramer said.

item.title: ‘Buckle up!’ Social media braces for Roaring Kitty’s first livestream in 3 years
Robinhood defies the SEC by forking over $200 million for a crypto exchange
item.description: The company, which received a Wells Notice from the SEC in May, touted the move as “a major step in growing our crypto business.”

item.title: Milwaukee-based retail giant Kohl's says 'No' to sponsoring Republican convention events
item.description: The Republican National Convention in Milwaukee will be missing one major hometown sponsor this year.

item.title: U.S. stocks close mostly flat as Wall Street eyes Friday's jobs report
